intro: Crambe wildpretii, commonly known as the wild pretti pea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, alternate leaves, and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Crambe wildpretii is also noted for its potential as a source of oilseed, making it of interest in agricultural research.
